intro: Norantea goyasensis var. sessilis, commonly known as the Goyasensis sessile variant, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its distinctive botanical features. It is native to specific regions in South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with short, sessile leaves that are often densely clustered at the base. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically displaying a range of colors from white to pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
